net.ligreto.builders
Class ReportTarget

java.lang.Object
  net.ligreto.builders.ReportTarget
All Implemented Interfaces:
TargetInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExcelReportTarget
public abstract class ReportTarget
extends java.lang.Object
implements TargetInterface

This class defines the interface between the various report executors and the target report format. The main type of the output report format is excel spreadsheet. However, any type of the output report format could be used if the below interface could be implemented. This is the overall overview on what methods should be called during life-cycle of this class in pseudo-code as called by the executors. 

   setTemplate("Template.xls");
   setOutput("Output.xls");
   
   for (tgt : targets) {
        setTarget("A target ID string"); // For spreadsheet - e.g. "B:2"
        for (row : rows) {
                nextRow();
                // Dump the i-th column from the ResultSet
                setColumn(i, rs); 
                // Could dump more columns here using setColumn method call
                setColumnPosition(10);
                // Could dump more columns here to shifted location using setColumn method call
        }
   }
The report builder could automatically highlight the differences or otherwise highlight certain column values as specified by invoking setHighlightArray before the call to any setCell methods.

Author:
Julius Stroffek

Field Detail

reportBuilder

protected ReportBuilder reportBuilder
The report builder that created this target

ligretoNode

protected LigretoNode ligretoNode
The parent node from the XML file for reference to other objects.

columnStep

protected int columnStep
The number of columns to shift right after the call to setColumn.

baseRow

protected int baseRow
The base row which is defined by the call to setTarget. The numbering starts from 0.

baseCol

protected int baseCol
The base column which is defined by the call to setTarget. The numbering starts from 0.

actRow

protected int actRow
The actual row number where the output is being produced.

Initially this starts one row before the base row as this will get shifted by the call to nextRow

actCol

protected int actCol
The actual column number where the output is produced. The exact column number where the function setColumn stores the content is produced by taking this actCol value and adding the value of the column number argument specified in the setColumn method call.

highlightArray

protected int[] highlightArray
The array defining which columns should be highlighted by setColumn.

highlight

protected boolean highlight
Indicates whether the columns should be highlighted.

rgbHlColor

protected short[] rgbHlColor
Specifies the highlight text color for highlighted cells.

ligretoParameters

protected LigretoParameters ligretoParameters
The global ligreto parameters.

getHlColor

protected short[] getHlColor(int i)
This method will return the highlight color for the specified column number based on the array content defined by setHighlightArray method call.

Parameters:
i - The column number.
Returns:
The corresponding highlight color or null.

dumpColumn

public void dumpColumn(int i,
                       java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                       int rsi)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
This method will set the value in the output report at the i-th position and taking the rsi-th position value from the specified result set.

Specified by:
dumpColumn in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
i - The report output column index.
rs - The result set where to get the data.
rsi - The result set index number where to get the value from.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - in case of database related problems.

The first output column index is 0.

The first result set column index is 1.

nextRow

public void nextRow()
             throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
Move the output processing to the next row. The highlightArray is replaced with null. The row number is increased and the actual column is set to the base column value.

Specified by:
nextRow in interface TargetInterface
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Parameters:
highlightArray -

The highlight array will be erased by the call to nextRow method.

setColumnPosition

public void setColumnPosition(int column,
                              int step,
                              int[] highlightArray)
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
This method sets the column position for setColumn function. The position have to be specified relatively to the baseColumn position.

Specified by:
setColumnPosition in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
column - The relative position to baseColumn.
step - The number of cells to be skipped between column i and i+1.
highlightArray - The array which determines the highlighting of the columns in the row actually processed.
